thread.title: For John Prikryl, Rodd & Gunn's creative force, quality equals time
thread.title_full: For John Prikryl, Rodd & Gunn's creative force, quality equals time | afr.com

author: Katarina Kroslakova
title: For John Prikryl, Rodd & Gunn's creative force, quality equals time
text:
For inspiration, John Prikryl can't go past New Zealand. Wayne Taylor by Katarina Kroslakova Favourite designer?
Hedi Slimane in his early years at Dior Homme for basically transforming the male silhouette. And Giorgio Armani in his early years for his mastery of fabrics.
Favourite watch?
Rolex Explorer, any era. I don’t wear a watch at the moment but the release of the Apple Watch actually piqued my interest in traditional watches. The Rolex Explorer is understated and underappreciated, it seems. Not too flashy and tells the time. It’s on my list.
Favourite car?
An old BMW 3 Series, or a Land Rover Defender for if I ever had time on my weekends. I appreciate cars that don’t beep too much. I had a brand new hire car in Italy recently and I swear there was not a moment it wasn’t beeping at me for some reason. Key in ignition, beep. Door open, beep. Luggage in the boot, beep. Speed camera ahead, beep. Need to shift up a gear, beep. Cars should be quiet.
Most treasured tech?
My MacBook Air. It makes life – and emails – while travelling easier.
Your preferred charity?
All charity is worthwhile and an underrated concept. I have a rescue Kelpie. Cruelty and negligence towards animals bewilders me. Cruelty in general I obviously find disturbing but seeing animals treated like a commodity gets to me.
Favourite drink?
Aperol Spritz in the European summer and red wine in the Melbourne winter. I seem to be stuck between the two at the moment, so can I say both? Or does that sound like I drink too much? And coffee every morning – I live in Melbourne after all.
Favourite way to travel?
Turning left whenever I can. Or in a four-wheel-drive on a back road of New Zealand’s South Island.
Best spot for relaxation?
I’ve never had a lie-on-a-beach overseas vacation so it would have to be the family beach house on Main Beach, up in Queensland. Salt air, salt water and family dinners cure everything.
 Favourite destination for inspiration?
New Zealand for its connection to Rodd & Gunn and its naturalness. It’s hard not to be inspired when in R&G heartland, especially the South Island; the colours and changes in seasons are pretty epic.
Europe and North America are great for observing people, for inspiration and for shopping. I try to visit a new destination at least once each major work trip to keep an open mind and not fall into too much of a routine. This month I’m going to Copenhagen for 24 hours in between appointments.
What was your first luxury purchase?
A pair of leather-soled Prada penny loafers that I wore for about a decade before they finally gave out. They taught me the value of well-made shoes that last.
What does luxury mean to you?
Symbolically? Time. Physically? Things that last and quality that is made to last – whether it’s clothes, leather, luggage, shoes, buildings or furniture. Usually these things take time to build and craft. So I guess it all comes back to time!
John Prikryl is the creative director of Rodd & Gunn.
